structured.description: A Spring Boot configuration class called `CorsConfig` that enables cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) for the entire application by adding mapping rules to the CORS registry. The `allowedOrigins` field is used to specify the allowed origins, while the `addCorsMappings` method adds the mapping rules to the registry.

items.description: Is used to configure cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) for a Spring Web MVC application. The class provides a registry for adding mapping rules to allow CORS requests from any origin, specify which methods, headers, and credentials are allowed, and enable credential support.
items.name: CorsConfig

items.description: Adds CORS mapping rules to a registry, allowing requests from any origin and specifying which methods, headers, and credentials are allowed.

returns.description:
a configuration for cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) that allows requests from any origin and specifies allowed methods, headers, and credentials.

* `registry`: The Cors registry that is being modified by adding mapping rules to allow cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) requests.
* `allowedOrigins`: A list of allowed origins for CORS requests.
* `allowedMethods`: A list of allowed HTTP methods for CORS requests.
* `allowedHeaders`: A list of allowed headers for CORS requests.
* `exposedHeaders`: A list of exposed headers for CORS requests.
* `allowCredentials`: Whether credentials (e.g., cookies, authorization headers) are allowed for CORS requests.

items.name: corsConfigurer

items.description: Adds CORS mappings to a registry, allowing requests from any origin and specifying which methods, headers, and credentials are allowed.

params.name: registry
params.description: Cors registry that is being updated with the specified mapping.

usage.description: The method addCorsMappings is called on the registry object, which is passed in as a parameter. The method adds a mapping for any URL to allow cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) requests from any origin with any methods and headers and exposes the headers "token" and "userId".

items.name: addCorsMappings
